Reviews.Title: “Not Happy”
Reviews.Author: Craig S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Got put in a room with no working TV remote, i ended up fixing things myself. Room was untidy, wardrobe broke, explained but told hotel full despite knowing it wasn't, at least discovering that. I asked for a double room but they said they only had twin. Other guests said they had been put in a double, will not be staying here again :(

Reviews.Title: “In dire need of a makeover; overpriced”
Reviews.Author: plfa
Reviews.Content: I need to start off by saying that I only booked one night at the Catalonia Park Guell because the other hotel where I had been staying was full on the 21st April. For some reason, this weekend it was extremely hard to find ANY hotel room in Barcelona, so the Catalonia Park Guell had to suffice. The hotel just looks old and tired, with everything reminding me of the late 80’ies or early 90’ies. Definitely not my first choice of décor. The rooms look cheap and overused, definitely not cozy and inviting. Even though everything was clean, it just doesn’t feel nice. Internet connection (free) was slow and erratic. Breakfast was not included (it costs €13) and if you want to use the safety box, you will be charged 5€. No comment. But the worst was the noise. The rooms are very poorly isolated and you can hear every step and conversation in the hallway, every car driving by in the street, and even the running water in the room next door! It’s a shame actually, because the staff is very friendly and professional, and everything was smooth from check-in to checkout. Service is the only reason I rated this hotel 'poor' and not 'terrible'. I probably wouldn’t have bothered writing a review at all, but at €180 for one night, I just feel this was a total rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel -- great pool rooftop”
Reviews.Author: BeautifulnRyan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here as part of the travel package to Spain. The hotel itself was fine – we had a great view of the hill and it was basic and clean; that plus free wifi was all we needed. The staff was very nice and helpful. The breakfast was fine – nothing special, but it was also a buffet so you can’t really expect too much anyways. The metro was close and it was a quick ride to the city (it was also about 7 to 10 euros for a cab ride back from Las Ramblas). The only issue we had was the noise -- the walls are very thin, but for the most part, everyone was pretty considerate on their noise level except the first night, which had to have been the last night of a school group. Our favorite part of the entire hotel was the rooftop pool at the 6th floor. It was March and still cold (even though it was unseasonably warm, it was not warm enough), but I wanted to see the pool anyways. We got up there and were amazed on how nice it was (and shocking compared to our room). We ended up spending two hours relaxing with a glass of wine (and him – a cigar) and watching the sunset and the view. It was a perfect ending to our trip! FYI – using the metro: When you arrive to the Vallcarca exit, go to the doors to the right and take the long escalator up. When you get to the top, look behind you and you will see a bridge. You need to head towards that, turn right onto it, and go along that bridge until you reach a small traffic circle. You will see a sign that says Mare de Deu del Coll pointing up and you will follow up that one more block up to the hotel. My husband and I made the mistake of going to the shorter set of stairs and went a long backwards way through the neighborhood when we arrived. It was not a fun walk!

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Chrystalla S
Reviews.Content: First of all we had to pay more money when we got there than the price we booked on line! They couldn’t give us a reason and because we couldn’t find another hotel we didn’t get a choice. Very noisy, not very clean especially the bathroom, horrible smell and you can’t get fresh air through those windows. Very disappointing, nothing around the area like they advertise. Had to walk to metro station and travel for half an hour at least to get to the centre. Breakfast bad! We got sick the first day after we ate and had a coffee in the hotel. Not recommended!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: echoytx
Reviews.Content: Spent quite a bit of effort finding this hotel after existing the underground train. Had to walk up a hill! Dainty little room in a quiet neighborhood, but most taxi drivers have no problems finding it after simply say "Hotel Catalonia". It is NOT that easy to find the way to walk to Parc Guell but going downtown on autobus was easy enough. It's a good value considering the room is sufficiently equipped, and the hotel provides free wi-fi and comes with a cafe with BIG breakfast selection. The bathroom was dimly lit, bed was a bit stiff.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious”
Reviews.Author: anonymous12_11
Reviews.Content: not like your typical tiny european room. clean and has a wonderful view of the city. you could get two double beds turned into 1. you would have to catch a train or bus to go to the city though. a short ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced in a good location”
Reviews.Author: El-Pescador007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 3 nights in the Catalonia Park Guell, formerly known as the Catalonia Rubens. The price was 195 Euros, which we found very reasonable for Barcelona. Finding free parking was a bit challenging but we were fortunate enough that the local Guardia Urbana offered to move their vehicle (parked in a nearby street) to let us park our car (thanks, folks!!!). If you are driving a vehicle, your best bet may be parking it and using public transportation while in Barcelona. We enjoyed our stay, and would not hesitate going back again. Pros: Reasonably priced, clean, AC in the room, friendly staff. Cons: No fridge in the room, finding free parking can be difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Catalonia Park Guell - rating”
Reviews.Author: Wawrzek
Reviews.Content: Advantages: - room with excellent view - really nice location (green area, calm, close to Park Guell) - very close to the metro station (Vallcarca), so excellent connection to City Centre - nice service - clean rooms (incl. bathroom) - reasonable price Minor disadvantages: - too expensive breakfast (it is better to go to one of the bars on Argentina street) - noisy air conditioning - once we tried to change our room due to lack of twin bed (two separate beds were only available), we were offered much less attractive room (no view, old TV, small size) . In the end we decided to stay in our cosy room with two separate beds :)

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: sonya k
Reviews.Content: not an easy hotel to find, had bad odor in the room and the worst part was the flying bugs (gnats, maybe?) coming out from the bathroom drain and keeping you company all night!!! all that for 120 euros/night!!!! would never go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: ankutzzza
Reviews.Content: We came in Barcelona for 4 days and we had paid very little for our accommodation so we didn't expect too much...mainly because we intended to visit most of the time.But when we arrived we had a big surprise..the room was very nice and the bathroom even better.The staff o.k. and the only downside i think it would be the location...a bit too far from the center and by the end we were a little sick of the subway but all in all i would recommend this hotel to everyone !

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean--great combo for an inexpensive stay”
Reviews.Author: divingaggie
Reviews.Content: We were a student group traveling through Europe, and for the Barcelona stop, this was our hotel. We expected a cheap place as it was a student tour group, but we were very pleasantly surprised by the hotel. First of all, the location isn't right in the middle of the city, but the price is worth it. It is a short, straight-shot trip on the Metro to Las Ramblas. The walk from the hotel to the stop takes maybe five to ten minutes, and it's a pretty walk. The views throughout the walk are beautiful during the day and at night. The rooms that we stayed in were minimal, but clean. It had what we needed: clean beds, shower, a decent amount of space, and FREE WIFI! Having traveled through Europe, I appreciated that. The hotel staff were very friendly, and we also had access to free newspapers. Our stay included a buffet breakfast which was delicious. The pastries were freshly baked, and there was hot food (bacon, ham, eggs) along with cereals, breads, and fruit. The only problem we experienced was that one of the rooms we had didn't have a working shower. The girls had to take baths, and although we asked them to fix it a few times, it was never fixed. The girls were okay with it. If you are looking for an inexpensive hotel for Barcelona, this is a very good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: george2210_P
Reviews.Content: We were a group and we had booked several rooms. When we arrived they didn't have only double rooms as we had required, but they gave us single, double or triple rooms. The bad thing was that some of us had to move the next day in other rooms. I didn't understand clearly why. We had a problem with one door, it remanined locked. We complained to reception and one man came and unlocked the door but after some hours the problem reappeared and we asked for changing the room.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME, NO MATTER WHAT,”
Reviews.Author: othellosuks
Reviews.Content: Even hostals cannot compare to this hotel, staff so freindly, and service great, anything you asked, it wasnt noisy when I was there, rates get higher for holidays, best value in barcelona, no doubt, I have no issue with this hotel, Metro is close, l3, and buses go right to the corner, metro to valcarca, and walk up argentina ave side, bus right there, across bridge or walk, then up next to bank, 300 feet,,, parc guell right there,,

Reviews.Title: “Very nosy”
Reviews.Author: ralucavanessa1983
Reviews.Content: It is extremly nosy!After a day of walking and visiting Barcelona, at night you can not rest at all.The traffic is crowded, even during night. The personell was very friendly, the food very good, it was clean but the furniture very old.There is no isolation for the windows and the hotel room.Our room was at 2.nd floor and we could see the hollway under the door.I was dissapointed because everything was really nice except the noisy nights!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: BGLIFE
Reviews.Content: Regarding the relatively low price the hotel was good enough. Especially for people that do not plan to spend their time in Barcelona staying at the hotel. The service: The staff was really friendly, but only the receptionists had English. The personnel in the breakfast place was speaking only Spanish, sometimes typically loud. I stayed for 6 nights, on the 3rd the fire alarm killed everyone's sleep in 5 am. I had my all luggage ready with me down into the lobby just for 3 minutes, but I was the only one. Most of the people were dressed with their sleep clothes, without luggage, using the lift, not the stairway. The reason for the alarm was the kitchen where the cook had done some smoke, so no real fire. If it was for real I guess the slowness of the people's reaction would have lead to many victims. I am not sure though that the staff could make something about people's reaction. The receptionist were helpful with tourist hints, there were a lot of maps and flyers into the lobby. The room: Not large space, but enough for people that are outside most of the time. The room was clean, the bathroom was clean too, although I could recommend a little renovation there. There was a little table where I put my laptop. There was free WiFi, but the signal was weak into the room (and good at the lobby). The air conditioner was a little bit noisy and old, but still efficient. The breakfast: Really tasty and variable food, a good choice of juices. The location: Well, the center of the city is far, but there is the Vallcarca station of the Underground's Green Line at 5 minutes walking. In Fridays it is working till 2 am and in Saturdays the service is non-stop, so the travelers that prefer spending for food, museums and activities could use it. Being distant from the heart of the city, the hotel is about half kilometer away from the impressive Park Guel. The whole area looked calm and safe (typically residential one), but be aware of the traffic on the hotel's street and the habit of Catalonia's citizens to leave their dogs' dirt on the sidewalks! Construction works made some noise in the mornings, but I do have a good sleep. The amenities: I mentioned already the WiFi and the air conditioner, there was satellite TV, but the parking was not free. As a resume, I was satisfied from the hotel because I received a good service for the price I had paid. The atmosphere of the hotel is also not bad and the charm of the whole city would make any imperfections not so visible.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: ArtemisP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights over the Easter holidays. It is in a great place with a metro station around the corner and a little shop not too far away. The Staff were friendly and helpful but the hotel itself was very noisy at night! There were several parties of school kids there when we were visiting which didn't help. All in all it is agreat little hotel to explore Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Superb, friendly accommodation”
Reviews.Author: debandrich
Reviews.Content: We went with some trepidation having read negative reviews about the locale, staff, quality and cleanliness of rooms but we are baffled about what people found to complain about. The location of the hotel was on the outskirts but in a respectable area with easy access to the metro. Yes, a bit of a hill but an escalator helped with 50% of it. the room was spotless and well-appointed, the staff friendly and mostly English speaking. Sensational breakfast - buffet style with an amazing range. Only one small cavill - the first night was clearly the last night for a school group who were partying in the next room but after that it was fine - and i suppose we could have complained . . . Reccomended, excellent value and we will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of a restaurant, which is advertised, only a snack-bar.”
Reviews.Author: patsylandin
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the evening, after a long day travelling, wanted to eat and was told they do not open the restaurant unless large groups or parties are booked. We tried the snack bar, which was very busy, not enough staff and very little to eat. We were charged for two of the tapas dishes which had ordered but did not receive. They eventually put the bill right. The staff were very helpful after the bill was sorted. The rooms were satisfactory and kept very clean and tidy. Breakfast in the snack-bar was very good, plenty of variety and everything was kept topped up. The location of the hotel is fine as long as you can negotiate the steep hill from the metro station, and you do not want a restaurant near the hotel as there are none.

Reviews.Title: “only disadvantage - remoteness from centre”
Reviews.Author: Evgeny S
Reviews.Content: +:Clean. Quiet. Good rooms. Low price (50euro/night). Near to Guel park (20 min walk). -:Far from center (10 min to Underground station + 15 min on it.)

Reviews.Title: “CHeap and good”
Reviews.Author: LeonidB
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, near metro station, on the hill with good view. Clean rooms, good service. But don't use this hotel in cold times - rooms are not warm at all.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel with bad location”
Reviews.Author: alza1
Reviews.Content: Bad location, long walk up a hill in a scary area from the metro. Not recommended for females or men that don't want to get mugged. Rude night staff, although the man during the day was nice and did give me directions. Decent breakfast. Dark, dingy, small room with beat up furniture, saggy mattresses, and thirty year old TV's. Small, creepy bathroom with see-through frosted glass door that did not lock. Rooftop terrace that I really wanted to see, but was always closed. Staff was again rude when I asked when it was open, and I got no answer, just some mumbling and snapping. Avoid if at all possible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, shame about the lack of tea & coffee”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Pete56
Reviews.Content: The staff are friendly and welcoming. They are prepared to take time to speak to you and listen to your questions. The facilities are generally good, the beds are large (long and wide), and there are extra blankets if required. The only thing that lets the accommodation down is the lack of in-room tea / coffee. The hotel was very clean, and always being cleaned. Our room was cleaned while we were at breakfast one morning! The breakfasts are adequate, and there is a reasonable selection to choose from. The only slight complaint is that things are topped up rather slowly. The real down side is that the hotel is five stops on the L3 tube from the centre of the city. Even though transport services in Barcelona are very good, it is a bit far. It is difficult to rate value accurately as the exchange rate is very poor at the time of writing.

Reviews.Title: “poor”
Reviews.Author: stoquila
Reviews.Content: our room was without a window with a door to noise neighbours and cockroaches(

Reviews.Title: “It`s a steep climb to this average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jlrobins87
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rubens was good for the money we spent to stay there, but the rooms were not 3 star quality in my opinion. The beds were a bit uncomfortable and the airconditioner made noises even when it was unplugged! The lobby is very nice and there is a small resturant there which serves food at a decent price. I would have liked to stay closer to the city center, but for what we paid, I guess we couldn`t beat it.

Reviews.Title: “3 stars in the 1970s maybe”
Reviews.Author: gourmandadventurer
Reviews.Content: This is one of those hotels that needs a facelift. It's not quite a 2 star and it's not quite a 3 star. It's very out of the way if you want to be in the middle of Barcelona action and the rooms are plain almost dorm like. You can tell by the marble tubs the hotel was once nice and needs some updating now. The Internet is reliable but the server certificate is expired which makes me worry it's not secure! For 70 Euros I'd mch rather be closer in to town...but I booked this at th last minute. I honestly don't believe the original price was 200 Euros for my room where I couldn't even fit my suitcase past the 2nd twin bed. I do believe this hotel caters to groups of teams which I think it does. Nothing near and I'm forced to have overpriced beer. (Very funny they have a beer vendign machine for 3 Euros...rip!)

Reviews.Title: “So far the best of Hoteles Catalonia, great value very good staff. Worthy for your visit”
Reviews.Author: Patoluna
Reviews.Content: EVALUATION REPORT Subject: Hotel Catalonia Rubens, part of the Catalonia Hoteles (handled as self standee subject) Category: 3 star Hotel Location: Barcelona city, Catalunya, Spain Report made by: V.P. Kovac, General manager/Project leader Evaluation day: 134 Subject: 31/13 Europe Our rating: 8,70 Verbal evaluation 1. Location Location is easy reachable. Parking however seems a bit difficult. If you will arrive by taxi which we suggest it will be the easier way. We could reach hotel also by metro, however, prepare for a bit of physical performance. Make no mistake; this walk to the hotel will not take more than 10 minutes and its pretty nice walk. Hotel is reachable. Our points for the location and all mentioned above are: 2. Reception Reception is placed in the easy reach of from the door. Personal was very helpful, kind and smiling. I have to say, that after our travel this was one of the best receptions. Information we requested were answered with friendliness, customer concern and care. I have also give credit for the professional approach to the day shift with no difference. 3. Hotel’s hall and others Generally hotel’s hall to the way to the elevators was clean, taking care of. Atmosphere was as expected in the hotel of this category. There is possibility to use internet and PC terminal. We did find also board with touristic suggestions. 4. Elevator Elevator is small, but under circumstance is adequate to the category of the hotel 5. Room I have to say we were pleasantly surprised. Room was spacious and clean. Bathroom was clean and nice. Room had a sufficient balcony, which came as complete surprise and was a big satisfactory. Surroundings were not noisy. Furniture was a bit out of date, but that is not major problem. However, the TV should have some possibilities of reach more international channels. A/C was however not sufficient at all and was very out of date. Plugs were very reachable. Room had telephone which was working with all expectations. The rest of equipment was present as bathroom amenities etc. We consider the storage space very helpful. 6. Room service Room service was very efficient and for its category very helpful and also informative and with no disturbance present. Cleaning was satisfaction and in case of not disturb sign, which is as we had experienced not considered in many of the today’s hotels, was handled with not just no disturbance but feedback from room service was very informative. 7. Lobby bar x Kitchen Lobby bar personal was very helpful and professional too. The environment was nice and good design touch. As we experienced kitchen food was tasty and its appearance satisfaction. We do have one remark thou, there was one staff which was helpful, but did not answer all the time on simple things like thank you etc. It seems that it depends which leg he get up in the morning. Mood is not good guide. However, although those troubles we got used to it, not because it was not present, but because in general even this person was helpful. We do think that even he did not smile a lot, or his customer care understanding is not that good at least with us, his behavior toward other people was very correct and even towards us he was professional all the time. Also, if you are to offer one day bread while customer wait for food with butter, you can not offer the same thing without butter and other day again with butter and so on. It is confusing GENERAL COMMENTS This hotel is satisfaction and I have to say that so far from the same company it is the best we’ve been to. I have feeling that I would be not shame to recommend and I would return. There is some space for making some steps to be better, however it will be always. I do miss corporate thinking. I would recommend also to place hotels souvenirs shop, with coffee mug with company logo, papers etc. which we can provide very cheap with our sources in Asia and it would be very nice for the hotels catalunya as corporate marketing. I would place this sign in the lobby. Internet is available and functional. This hotel is qualified for corporate recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: silarem
Reviews.Content: This hotel was included in a tour package so I don’t really know what the price was. The hotel is obviously not in the center but getting to the metro is not that bad and if you prefer a bus stop that is even closer. If you are a solo female I’ll advise that if coming late to the hotel, a taxi is recommended since not many people were walking on our way back from the metro and it was around 11pm. The room was perfect for me, very basic but exactly what I needed for my stay. There are no restaurants around so you either go downtown or have something at their restaurant. The only thing that I did not liked about the hotel was the noise from the people in the corridors, large groups of teenagers where all around and of course it didn’t matter to them to throw doors and shout so always bring your earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Quick 2 nights away”
Reviews.Author: Bingley1
Reviews.Content: Too far way from the centre, very very basic but clean enough. We only booked because it was cheap but now we realise why ! You only get what you pay for. 20 mins from the centre by tube and a 10 minute uphill walk from the tube station. Nothing in the surrounding area, seems to be residential. I would only stay there again if every other hotel in central Barcelona was fully booked !!! In my honest opinon hotel is ok if you don't mind planning your trip by the tube timetable.......

Reviews.Title: “only if you like dust in your room”
Reviews.Author: alfido
Reviews.Content: At arrival, the desk manager told us about a problem with hot water, so they try to change us to another hotel. We didn't agree, so they gave us a room. Only the minimal confort, but we foun over the phone, tv, and radiator, dust of several days; and in the bathroom, a coackroach. The food at the restaurant was good. I won't come back.

Reviews.Title: “Catalonia Rubens-Great Location and nice!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug54321
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a student tour to France and Barcelona organized by www.explorica.ca. The highlight of the trip was Barcelona. The hotel we booked, Catalonia Rubens, was great, convenient, trendy, nice breakfast and safe. It is located right by Parc Guell (Gaudi Park)---Cannot miss this attraction. It is located 5 min from the Vallcarca metro stop and if you're tired at the end of day, a cab ride is 10 euros. the metro ride to city centre is less than 10 minutes. From the airport to hotel, it is 25 euros. The rooms are roomy, bathroom are supplied with amenities and a blow dryer (not all euro hotels provide this). The staff there were friendly and informative. The breakfast there was buffet style, with fresh baked bread, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, cheese, yogurt, cereal, orange juice, coffee and tea. I highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: jane075
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Rubens in Barcelona with an Explorica student group and this was a great little hotel. It was a 10-15 minute walk from the Valcarrca Metro stop and very close to the Parc Guell. The buffet breakfast was excellent with lots of variety and freshly baked pastries/bread every morning. Rooms were also a decent size and modern. - Irene, staff member of Explorica (www.explorica.com) an educational tour company

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Pokerwanabe8
Reviews.Content: This is hotel is the definition of "average" Its clean and that's it. The Pictures if you haven't noticed are showing only the ground floor which is really new and stylish. However the next 4 floors are a bit dated and lifeless. Don't book with this hotel if you've got family cause we had a room for 3 and i slept on a wooden plank and a mattress the size of a suitcase. Also don't rely on the electricity, one night we were completely without it and suddenly it got a bit warm. But if you're looking for a quick city break with your partner I would probably recommend it to you cause its location is brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: puishor
Reviews.Content: We've spent 3 nights in this hotel. We've booked a double room but when we got there we received a twin room, we asked them to change the room but they said they didn't have any available double rooms and that we should have specified in the reservation request that we want a double room with a queen size bed( on the site we've booked a double room was described as a room with a double bed, so we didn't think we had to say that again). The hotel's location is not central, but it's 5 min uphill from a metro station, so it's ok if you don't mind walking. The rooms are simple and clean, but extremely noisy. We could here our neighbours talking, showering, etc and the cleaning lady working in the hallway and the rooms nearby. And as she starts pretty early, it was pretty difficult to sleep.The front desk staff speak English and are very friendly. We didn't take the breakfast in the hotel as it was too expensive. They ask 12 euros/pers for buffet breakfast, while in the restaurants on Les Ramblas we didn't pay more than 15 euros for both of us, including drinks. If you plan to spend a lot of time in the hotel we don't recommend this one, but if you need a clean place to sleep at a low price, it's ok.

Reviews.Title: “absolute nightmare”
Reviews.Author: haze2375
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from staying at this hotel. Please can someone offer me a chiropractor now as i have such back pain from sleeping in the most noisy uncomfortable broken bed for a week. I booked into the hotel thinking it looked close to town and from the photos it looked ok. The reception area is very misleading, its nice there, that is until you get out of the lift and onto your floor, where you step into a time warp. the wooden doors are all bashed up, the wallpaper is some type of rattan wicker nightmare with browning cream walls. the first room i was given was a strange triangle room, where if i closed my eyes i felt like i was alongside the grand pre circuit. it was so loud from the traffic. As i was there on business i asked for a quiet room as i couldnt sleep. I was then given a small coffin room where there was enough space to just get out and into the bed, which was broken. It was quiet from traffic, but this time all you can hear is everyone else talking and making noise. After another sleepless night, and worry of impending impaling from the coils in the mattress i asked for a new mattress, or some help flipping the old one over, the lady at reception moaned at me to the maid, thinking i didnt understand them, then sent the handy man up, who confirmed that the bed was broken and he would fix it tomorrow, he didnt come the next day or the next or the next after that. i complained each day and i felt like i was being annoying to them! they werent bothered at all that i was sleeping on a broken bed, infact the staff give you the impression that you are getting in their way , especially if you want to go down in the lift whilst they are doing the cleaning, there are no seperate lifts for them , so be wary of making them wait, one cleaner was quiet annoyed that i happened to join her in the lift. other than all that, the food was cheap if you like your burger to swim in its own grease you'll be fine.. Dont go dont go dont go..

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Finnjack
Reviews.Content: Location is not great. But the Taxi stop is very close and the metro about 5 mins downhill. Room was a bit plain but the bathroom ok. The biggest problem was the noise from the traffic and other (young people / school groups) in the hotel (No sound insulation at all...). Bring your own ear plugs to this place! Hotel didn't have a real restaurant, only a 'snack bar'. Breakfast and personnel did their job nicely. Rooms were also very clean.

Reviews.Title: “not the best option, nonetheless reasonable”
Reviews.Author: runacandy
Reviews.Content: Second time in Barcelona, and booked this hotel mainly for the price. Location is not its best feature, however there's a metro stop (Vallcarca - Green line) at about 5 minute walk.. Concerning the hotel itself have to say it's a bit depressive one. Nice lobby and entrance bar but the rooms are small, old and need urgent maintenance. Stay away from low floored street rooms unless you like noise. The main breakfast room is on a 1st floor with low ceiling and no windows... Only after 2 days did we discover that you can have breakfast on the restaurant upstairs. Much nicer and breathable. The breakfast itself is poor in choice but satisfying and adequate. The staff: would not say rude, just uncaring... they seem to not care at all if like it or not... In general, would not recomend this hotel unless you're on a thight budget (would rate it at max 80,00 Eur per dbl room/night). There are much better choice in the fantastic city of Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended Staying at the Catalonia Rubens in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Jaymini
Reviews.Content: The Catalonia Rubens Hotel was NOT centrally located and was pretty far removed from the main area in Barcelona, which is the La Rambla area. The hotel was actually further up north in an area called Vallcarca. There was luckily a metro stop that could get me into the city, but it's about a 10 minute walk (up and down hill) to the metro station and not a convenient mode of transport on weeknights after the metro would shut down between 11pm-midnight (make sure to check the schedule!) The staff at the hotel, especially one dark - haired/brunette lady, was not friendly and not very helpful when I asked her about tours, or even things in the area. (She just guessed or assumed and gave me the wrong time that a tour office would close and I missed booking the tour.) When I asked a man at the front desk to show me on the map which way to walk to something, I verified the direction with him twice, but he had sent me the wrong way. Also, I was given a room where the toilet was not working and when I addressed the issue I was told it would be taken care of. Then I left the room for a few hours and came back at about 10pm, only to find that the toilet was STILL not working. I told the hotel staff about it again and a young man from the front desk walked up to my room with me and took a look at it, but then I was told I would have to wait until morning to have the toilet fixed. When I complained and asked for another room, I was informed that there were none available - and the guy said this without even knowing or checking at the desk. Then I raised a ruckus and FINALLY got a room (but it was smaller) with a working toilet. The bathroom was old and cracks were apparent here and there. Then - to add to the fun (NOT!) - on 2 days in a row I found bugs crawling out of the bathroom drain into the tub. YUCK! Another problem was that in the new room the phone was not working and I complained about it 4 times until someone FINALLY came to take a look at it. On the fourth time I marched down to the front desk and told the dark haired lady about it, only to be answered with, "...if you really need to use the phone then you can see we have a phone booth over there," and proceeded to point towards a wall opposite the desk. I told her that was not the point. The point was that I paid for a room with basic amenities included - and that would mean a working phone as well. She didn't say anything back to me at that point, but just went back to whatever she was doing. As a final blow, she couldn't check me out of the room correctly. It was a pre-booked room and she kept insisting she needed the credit card I booked it with. The problem was that I did not have that credit card as it was booked for me by a relative. After about 10 minutes of struggling with her on the issue, I decided to call the relative whose credit card it was and have him read the credit card information to me over the phone and hoped that the lady at the front desk would be able to type it in directly. She said no at first, but then I just asked a man who was at the desk behind her and he said it shouldn't be a problem. So that was that and as the final icing on the cake, that brunette woman had done one thing right (called a taxi to take me to the airport), BUT because of her issues on checking me out the taxi started charging me so I ended up paying 15 Euros more than I should have to get to the airport by taxi. Barcelona was nice, but this hotel just totally ruined the experience for me. Please do yourself a favor and DON'T STAY AT THE CATALONIA RUBENS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Economical and nice location”
Reviews.Author: louloupants
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel from May 20-28th. The hotel is in an area of Barcelona called Vallcarca. The hotel is walking distance to great restaurants, supermarkets, shops, cafe's ect. The hotel is also walking distance to Parc Guell which is very beautiful and a must see. I enjoyed staying at this hotel as the area of the city was very pretty and full of culture. The metro is a short walking distance (3 minutes) from the hotel which will take you anywhere you want to go in Barcelona. I would take a taxi at night back to the hotel which only cost me about 10-12 euros from the Olympic Port area. Is the hotel rooms small? yes the room is small, but you really only go there to lay your head down at night so for me it didnt matter and I was quite comfortable. The room was always clean and for me it was great and the price was right with my budget. The bed was not as good as home but I never had a problem sleeping in everyday. If you are a super light sleeper and a very cranky person who gets bothered by other people and noise, I would stay somewhere that has soundproof walls since the hotel can be a bit noisey at times but it did not bother me nor did I let that ruin the wonderful experience of staying in Barcelona and Vallcarca. I would definately return back to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Would return”
Reviews.Author: summa_days
Reviews.Content: To be honest didn't spend much time in the hotel, but the rooms were very clean, the breakfast was nice, and the hotel is an easy walk (but a bit of a long one) in to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Utter disgrace”
Reviews.Author: mbyoung
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it had a car park and 24 hour reception as our flght was to arrive later in the evening. Upon arrival my partner asked where the car park was and was told (with attitude) that it was full. This was a major problem as the hotel is surrounded by narrow one way streets with no parking. We drove round for an hour and eventually parked. When we finally got back to the hotel he told us (again, with attitude and without apology) that the hotel was full and we had no room, even though we had prepaid and he knew we were coming after seeing him for parking instructions. After 30 mins the solution he arrived at was that we pay for a taxi to an affiliated hotel and stay there, then pay for another taxi back again in the morning. This is the worst service I have received and would like to warn others of this so they can avoid it.

HotelInfo.Name: Catalonia Park Guell
HotelInfo.Address: Passeig Mare de Deu del Coll 10, 08023 Barcelona, Spain (Formerly Catalonia Rubens Hotel)
